required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PRV-based Detection of CAD in Comparison to Standard Methods
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of a Pulse Wave Based Approach for Detection of Coronary Artery Disease Compared to Standard Methods

brief_summary.textblock: This is a validation study comparing a pulse wave based algorithm for the detection of coronary artery disease with parameters from coronary angiography, echocardiography and cardiogoniometry.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will validate a pulse wave based algorithm for the detection of coronary artery disease (CAD) with parameters from standard methods. Subjects will be patients admitted to coronary angiography due to suspected CAD. Pulse wave signals will be analyzed according to novelly established algorithm regarding the presence of CAD and/or myocardial ischemia. These results be compared to the diagnoses made by coronary angiography (primary endpoint): presence of minimum one coronary artery stenose >=50%. For secondary analyses, results will be compared to parameters form echocardiography and cardiogoniometry.

primary_outcome.description: Presence of CAD in coronary angiography: minimum 1 stenosis >=50%

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence of CAD number - angio (Number of coronary vessels with at least 1 stenosis >=50% in coronary angiography)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of coronary vessels with at least 1 stenosis >=50% in coronary angiography

secondary_outcome.measure: Wall motion abnormality - echo (Presence of wall motion abnormality in at least 1 segment (2D echocardiography)
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of wall motion abnormality in at least 1 segment (2D echocardiography)

secondary_outcome.measure: Wall motion index - echo (Wall motion index (2D and 3D echocardiography)

intervention.description: Validation of a diagnostic algorithm used to detect coronary artery disease and/or myocardial ischemia based on pulse wave analyses.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects referred to first coronary angiography due to suspected CAD

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Coronary angiography indication present
- informed written consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous coronary angiography
- Known CAD (history of coronary angioplasty, stent implantation and/or bypass surgery)
- atrial fibrillation (at time of measurement)
- severe ventricular extrasystole (e.g. >=10% ventricular extrasystoles, bigemina)
- pregnancy, lactation
